entry.title: Looptober 2023
entry.content:
I decided to do looptober this year, too. And this year I’m using the Polyend Tracker. I wanted to try out all the new features of the 1.7 firmware, and experiment a bit with making instruments on it.

I prepared by using the auto name feature to create 31 named but empty projects, thinking the name will set the direction for the loop.

NB These are made to be played in a loop, but if you only want a quick peek they are still playable using the :play command.

NB2 Loops marked with X was not finished on time, but created and added later.

# 01 - Political Replacement (96 BPM) 4/4

The game is afoot!

# 02 - Guarded Pleasure (83 BPM) 4/4

Happy whistle tune, R.I.P Roger

# 03 - Nostalgic Club (76 BPM) 4/4

Random radio samples, sorry for the crackling

# 04 - Erratic Toes (103 BPM) 4/4

Only four days in and already a triple digit BPM!

# 05 - Longing Pump (48 BPM) 6/8

Another whistle tune? Well, yessirree!

# 06 - Wonderful Order (97 BPM) 4/4

Hey lame 90’s sax, nice to hear you again

# 07 - Hypnotic Magic (69 BPM) 4/4

Spooky!

# 08 - Necessary Ship (96 BPM) 4/4

I fixed the greasy encoder on my Tracker today, let’s celebrate with an extra loop! (2023-10-13)

# 09 - Callous Engine (87 BPM) 4/4

I will probably need to remix this when my ears aren’t bleeding (2023-10-13)

# 10 - Enchanted Thought (90 BPM) 4/4

Listening to old cambodian soul, I had to make a little loop (2023-10-19)

# 11 - Statuesque Railway (87 BPM) 4/4

No more catching up to do! For now… (2023-10-23)

# 12 - Dispensable Ladybug (110 BPM) 4/4

There is a very real possibility that this one could get tiresome quickly

# 13 - Sick Current (75 BPM) 4/4

More spooky!

# 14 - Irate Skate (82 BPM) 4/4

Well, there’s an I in Irate, right?

# 15 - Fallacious Argument (108 BPM) 4/4

Something for the sunday run

# 16 - Unique Border (75 BPM) 4/4

Half diggedy-done!

# 17 - Needy Bat (101 BPM) 4/4

I don’t know how needy the bat is, but at least the violin is transylvanian

# 18 - Keen Quill (77 BPM) 4/4

What a beautiful wednesday morning!

# 19 - Wild Snails (80 BPM) 4/4

Lolita Fatjo gave me a Casio DM-100, had to sample it!

# 20 - Nochalant Name (93 BPM) 4/4

If it’s atonal, you’re too anal

# 21 - Flaky Invention (102 BPM) 4/4

It’s like someone took a twelve-bar blues and broke it

# 22 - Voracious Rat (73 BPM) 4/4

I believe these are the chords from Nightshift, but in alphabetical order

# 23 - New Linen (75 BPM) 4/4

Ahh, new linen! That’s the best smell

# 24 - Quickest Week (71 BPM) 4/4

But it’s only tuesday!

# 25 - Thin Nation (87 BPM) 4/4

Stand for Palestine!

# 26 - Rural Dog

Coming up!

# 27 - Lackadaisical Stetch

Coming up!

# 28 - Waiting Cemetery

Coming up!

# 29 - Marked Expansion

Coming up!

# 30 - Dusty Amount

Coming up!

# 31 - Periodic Society

Coming up!

entry.title: Looptober 2022
entry.content:
Looptober? Why not! I saw it mentioned somewhere, but I couldn’t really find any “rules” so I decided to interpret it literally. Thus, from the first of October to the last of October, I created one short loop every day as a way of getting to know the Elektron Syntakt. Below are the fruits of that sometimes frustrating labor, along with the original comments where available. But first a summary.

# Conclusion

The stats show I’m depressingly consistant. The average BPM, 84.1, is pretty close to the mean BPM, 85. The difference between the the lowest BPM and the average is 25, the difference between the highest BPM and the average is 26. Like a perfectly adequately calibrated but slightly underwhelming pendulum.

A crushing majority of the loops are in 4/4 time, with only four in 3/4 time and one in 5/4 time. Probably what you’d expect, especially from someone so defiantly average.

I didn’t keep track of what keys the loops are in, but if I’d have to guess I’d say C is probably the most common.

If we look at the commit times, the average commit time is 11:46:04 and the mean commit time is 11:40:00 – most commits are clustered around noon. There are some outliers, however. The loop for October 2, aptly named Grvyrdshft1, is committed at a record-smashing 00:26:48.

All in all, it was a fun experiment, and a really good way to get to learn a new synth – similar to how gavage is a really good way of making foie gras.

That’s it, hope I didn’t steal anyone’s melody!

1

There has been some debate, though, as to whether Grvyrdshft really is short for Graveyard Shift. Some claim it stands for Groovy Redshift or even Gravy Rodshaft which I can only assume means something inappropriate.

# The loops

Here are the thirty one loops in order from first to last. I tried to keep the volume consistent, but some sounds are a bit loud and piercing so take caution.

NB These are made to be played in a loop, but if you only want a quick peek they are still playable using the :play command.

NB2 If you grow tired of the audio visualization, click it to switch to another type.

PROTIP The mute button only mutes when pressed, use it to add flair to your late night freestyle sessions.

# 01 - Duckboy (86 BPM) 4/4

No comment available

# 02 - Grvyrdshft (72 BPM) 4/4

No comment available

# 03 - Spacejoust (80 BPM) 4/4

No comment available

# 04 - Cibercryme (89 BPM) 4/4

No comment available

# 05 - Freakshow (75 BPM) 4/4

16% done and not one beat over 90 BPM!

# 06 - Ghoulsgrowl (75 BPM) 3/4

19% done and first BPM duplicate spotted. Sloppy!

# 07 - Loungehounds (83 BPM) 4/4

23% done and names are getting weirder

# 08 - Hira! Hira! (84 BPM) 4/4

Weekends are hard.

# 09 - Scaredycat (77 BPM) 4/4

Now pizza.

# 10 - Scatterbrain (94 BPM) 4/4

32% done. That’s almost a third!

# 11 - Strongman (81 BPM) 3/4

Definitely struggling to come up with stuff.

# 12 - Incoming (85 BPM) 4/4

Time to read the manual for inspiration.

# 13 - Brainhurt (98 BPM) 4/4

First barely listenable beat, and the fastest so far as well. Coincidence?

# 14 - Birthright (73 BPM) 4/4

So close to the halfway point I can almost feel it!

# 15 - Dropkick (90 BPM) 4/4

This bass line is the most difficult thing I ever programmed.

# 16 - KENTVCKY (71 BPM) 5/4

New time signature achievement obtained!

# 17 - Flatwheeler (64 BPM) 3/4

Record breaking low BPM!

# 18 - Fringehead (93 BPM) 4/4

93 is my favorite BPM.

# 19 - #haketlove (79 BPM) 4/4

Getting some #haketlove in there.

# 20 - Stockjock (85 BPM) 4/4

Stock sound challenge accepted!

# 21 - Ladybugs (98 BPM) 4/4

Two thirds officially crushed finished.

# 22 - Dirtroad (74 BPM) 4/4

Rock organ time.

# 23 - Panoptikon (88 BPM) 4/4

Watching Laura Kampf restore an old house helps with perspective.

# 24 - Snickertick (90 BPM) 4/4

Three fourths done, and tomorrow four fifths. The day after that, five sixths.

# 25 - Payday (111 BPM) 4/4

Entering triple digit BPM land.

# 26 - Algosmosis (59 BPM) 4/4

Letting the LFOs do the work today.

# 27 - Clowncar (108 BPM) 4/4

This is by far the dumbest yet.

# 28 - Indigo Days (89 BPM) 4/4

We’re on the home stretch!

# 29 - Sleuthypants (92 BPM) 4/4

Something from the Grim Fandango cutting room floor?

# 30 - Poltava (75 BPM) 4/4

ONE DAY LEFT!

# 31 - Rasubosu (90 BPM) 3/4

Time for a long vacation from beatmaking!
